Articles.Content:
So... My science teacher is obsessed with planes and stuff that has to do with them, and I had an idea the other day

I figured I could download some sort of recorder, and record a video of me flying a spaceplane to orbit and back,

Since a spaceplane is basically a plane that can go into space, I figure she'll like it,

But I have no idea wether or not she will, she's a major jerk at times, and kinda tends to be rude and stuff

Not the brightest of people, but I think it'd make her be nice to me for once,

But I don't have any recording software or anything,

Plus I don't know if I should try to make it a replica of the space shuttle, or some other design,

Any suggestions or something?
For recording, go with DXtory or FRAPS. Both will cost you money but they are worth it. There's also some freeware screen recorders you can find on google, they aren't normally as feature rich.
Problem is I don't have any money

Try out bandicam,It has a watermark,but its worth the watermark!

EDIT: just found out you had to pay for it...

but you can try the free version (10 minute limit)

Edited May 9, 2013 by BigBoy734
Camstudio if you don't care about quality. it IS free at the moment.
Bump? Come on guys how do you open it?
Try quicktime its free and should be able to set the part you record.
